Japan makes attractive additions to Ski & Snowboard Show this November
This year at the Ski & Snowboard Show starting from 5th – 8th November 2015 at Battersea Park in London is being planned with a difference. You will be given the true feel of a ski resort with snow-coated trees and stalls serving authentic alpine street food. There will be live music, including traditional Japanese entertainment, as well as comedy, wine tasting and much more. You can meet premier winter sports regions of Niigata, Nagano, Hokkaido and Tohoku who will offer you with rich tips to plan a perfect tour.
Japanese Alps ski experience at Nagano & Niigata
Nestled in the Japanese Alps, Nagano and Niigata prefectures are home to some of the best ski and snowboard resorts in Japan. In Nagano you’ll find Hakuba, host of the 1998 Winter Olympics, with more varied slopes and terrain than anywhere else in Japan. Nagano is also home to Shiga Kogen and the 200 wild monkeys who relax serenely there in the hot springs. Or in nearby Niigata, visit Myoko Kogen, one of the world’s oldest ski areas, or the Tokamachi Snow Festival with its skilfully carved snow sculptures and riveting firework displays. Representatives will be on hand to answer any of your Nagano or Niigata related ski questions.
Hokkaido Snow Festival
Hokkaido Ski Promotion Council helps promote Hokkaido as a tourist destination in Australia, Asia and other overseas countries. Hokkaido is Hokkaido Snow Festival known for having some of the world’s best powder snow, as cold Siberian winds crossing the Sea of Japan pick up moisture, which then falls as fluffy, dry powder across the whole of Japan’s northern island. Explore Niseko is the main independent information and booking centre in Niseko, Hokkaido. Niseko is celebrated for its spectacular backcountry and for being one of the top 5 resorts for ski and snowboard fans in Japan. Representatives from both Explore Niseko KK and Hokkaido Ski Promotion Council will be available to answer your questions.
Aspen of Japan
The region of Tohoko on Japan’s main island boasts some of the best snow conditions in Japan. Appi resort, nestled in Hachimantai National Park, is considered Japan’s own version of Aspen. Stunning views across Mount Iwate and Mount Hachimantai provide a dramatic backdrop to an adventurous day of skiing on one of Appi’s 21 slopes. These long, carefully groomed slopes, which stretch for lengths of up to 3.5 miles, also offer fantastic powder riding opportunities. Due to the size of this resort and the long season (which runs from early December right through until May), it’s an ideal place for winter sports fans who enjoy the peace of uncrowded slopes. Representatives from Iwate Hotel and Resort will be at the Japan stand throughout the Ski and Snowboard Show.
Tailor-made trips by JTB
JTB Europe is a Japan specialist travel agent and tour operator. With many years’ experience and excellent relations with suppliers throughout Japan, JTB offers great prices and a wealth of travel possibilities throughout the country. The company offers winter sports packages to the major resorts in Japan, and the team of specialist travel advisors in the London office can help to plan tailor-made trips to Japan including ski and snowboarding for families, couples or ski enthusiasts. Staff will be on hand during the event to discuss your specialised needs.
Group tour specialists
Unique Japan Tours is one of Japan’s leading travel specialist companies, organizing tailor made and specialized group tours of Japan. Their small group tours are an ideal way to explore Japan hassle-free. Their unique tours include ‘Forgotten Japan’, which allows visitors the opportunity to experience the Japan of ancient samurai, whilst their more active ‘Hokkaido Winter Action’ tour is designed to help you get the most out of Hokkaido’s soft, white slopes. Company representatives will be around during the ski show to answer any of your travel questions.
Winter Holiday experts
Japanese winter holiday experts, Japan Ski Experience offer custom itineraries and exquisite accommodation across five of Japan’s best resorts to provide your ideal Japan ski experience. Having operated as the UK’s leading Japan ski specialists for the last 7 years, they pride themselves on offering seamless trips, and making both the booking and travel experience a breeze. Visit them on their stand to talk about skiing in Japan.
One stop to Japan
The Japan National Tourism Organization is the ultimate resource for travel-related information about Japan. Visit our stand to have all your questions about skiing and boarding in Japan answered, and pick up free maps and brochures to plan your winter holiday in Japan.
